trans-unit.source: Multi-factor authentication using Azure AD| Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Multi-factor authentication using Azure AD| Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: How to require multi-factor authentication in Azure AD for device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: How to require multi-factor authentication in Azure AD for device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: Multi-factor authentication for Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Multi-factor authentication for Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune integrates Azure AD multi-factor authentication (MFA) for device enrollment to help you secure your corporate resources.
trans-unit.target: Intune integrates Azure AD multi-factor authentication (MFA) for device enrollment to help you secure your corporate resources.

trans-unit.source: MFA requires authentication factors like text authentication in addition to user names and passwords.
trans-unit.target: MFA requires authentication factors like text authentication in addition to user names and passwords.

trans-unit.source: This is supported for iOS, Android, Windows 8.1 or later, or Windows Phone 8.1 or later devices.
trans-unit.target: This is supported for iOS, Android, Windows 8.1 or later, or Windows Phone 8.1 or later devices.

trans-unit.source: In older versions of Configuration Manager (earlier than release 1610), you will still see the MFA setting in the Configuration Manager admin console.
trans-unit.target: In older versions of Configuration Manager (earlier than release 1610), you will still see the MFA setting in the Configuration Manager admin console.

trans-unit.source: Do not attempt to configure MFA in the Configuration Manager admin console, as it will not work.
trans-unit.target: Do not attempt to configure MFA in the Configuration Manager admin console, as it will not work.

trans-unit.source: Configure MFA as described in this topic.
trans-unit.target: Configure MFA as described in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Intune to require multi-factor authentication at device enrollment
trans-unit.target: Configuring Intune to require multi-factor authentication at device enrollment

trans-unit.source: To require MFA at device enrollment, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To require MFA at device enrollment, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to your [Microsoft Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) with your admin credentials.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your [Microsoft Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) with your admin credentials.

trans-unit.source: Choose your tenant.
trans-unit.target: Choose your tenant.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **applications** tab.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **applications** tab.

trans-unit.source: You will see a list of services for which you can configure Azure AD security features.
trans-unit.target: You will see a list of services for which you can configure Azure AD security features.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Microsoft Intune enrollment**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Microsoft Intune enrollment**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Under **multi-factor authentication and location-based access rules** you can:
trans-unit.target: Under **multi-factor authentication and location-based access rules** you can:

trans-unit.source: Enable the access rules
trans-unit.target: Enable the access rules

trans-unit.source: Choose whether to apply the rules to all users or to specific Azure AD security groups.
trans-unit.target: Choose whether to apply the rules to all users or to specific Azure AD security groups.

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication for enrollment of all devices.
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication for enrollment of all devices.

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication for enrollment when the device is not at work.
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication for enrollment when the device is not at work.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Block access to corporate resources** to prevent enrollment of a device when it is not connected to the corporate network.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Block access to corporate resources** to prevent enrollment of a device when it is not connected to the corporate network.

trans-unit.source: You can also click the link to **define/edit your work network location**, to configure network connectivity requirements for device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: You can also click the link to **define/edit your work network location**, to configure network connectivity requirements for device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: Do not configure **Device based access rules** for Microsoft Intune Enrollment.
trans-unit.target: Do not configure **Device based access rules** for Microsoft Intune Enrollment.
